intro: Biscutella laevigata proles oreites, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in water retention in arid environments. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in dry slopes and open woodlands.
